banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: "Sleep Sleep Beauty Bright"

nodes.whoTheyAre: Martha Redbone's music combines the blues of her childhood in the Appalachian hills of Kentucky with the eclectic grit of her teens in Brooklyn.
nodes.whyListen: Inspired by her African American fatherʼs gospel singing and the resilient spirit of her mother's Cherokee/Shawnee/Choctaw culture, Martha Redbone broadens the boundaries of Americana. Her albums Skintalk and The Garden of Love - Songs of William Blake are recognized in the Library Collection at the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian. Redbone is also a 2016 Fellow of the Native Arts and Cultures Foundation.to protect the rights of migrants and detained children in countries including Mexico, Brazil, Guatemala, and El Salvador.

videoData.description: In an enchanting lyrical rendition of William Blake's poem "Sleep Sleep Beauty Bright," singer Martha Redbone blends rhythm, blues and soul with traditional Native American music.
videoData.socialDescription: In an enchanting lyrical rendition of William Blake's poem "Sleep Sleep Beauty Bright," singer Martha Redbone blends rhythm, blues and soul with traditional Native American music.
